name: Small Business Administration (SBA) 7(a) Loan
repaymentTerms: Up to 10 years for working capital, up to 25 years for real estate
eligibility: Must be a for-profit business operating in the U.S., demonstrate ability to repay, and have invested equity.
description: The 7(a) loan program is the SBA's primary program for providing financial assistance to small businesses. It offers flexible loan terms and can be used for various business purposes.

name: SBA Microloan Program
eligibility: Startups, newly established businesses, or growing businesses. Ideal for working capital, inventory, supplies, furniture, fixtures, machinery, and equipment.
description: Microloans provide small amounts of capital to help businesses start and grow. These loans are delivered through mission-based lenders who are also able to provide business counseling.

name: Economic Injury Disaster Loan (EIDL)
eligibility: Available to businesses that have suffered substantial economic injury as a result of a declared disaster.
description: EIDL provides economic relief to businesses experiencing temporary loss of revenue. Low-interest rates and long-term repayment options.

name: Women-Owned Small Business (WOSB) Federal Contracting Program
eligibility: Business must be at least 51% owned and controlled by one or more women who are U.S. citizens.
description: Provides opportunities for women-owned businesses to compete for federal contracts in industries where women are underrepresented.

name: State Small Business Credit Initiative (SSBCI)
eligibility: Businesses in participating states. Programs vary by state. Check with your state's economic development office.
description: Federal program that supports state programs that increase access to credit for small businesses.

name: Venture Capital Seed Funding
eligibility: High-growth potential startups with scalable business models, strong founding team, and innovative products/services.
description: Equity investment from venture capital firms in exchange for ownership stake. Best for tech startups with high growth potential.

name: Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Grant
eligibility: Small businesses engaged in R&D with potential for commercialization. Must be for-profit and U.S.-owned.
description: Competitive grants program that encourages domestic small businesses to engage in Federal Research/R&D with commercialization potential.

name: Community Development Financial Institutions (CDFI) Fund
eligibility: Businesses in low-income communities or owned by minorities, women, or immigrants.
description: Provides capital to underserved communities through mission-driven financial institutions.

name: Business Line of Credit
repaymentTerms: Revolving credit, interest only on drawn amounts
eligibility: Established businesses with strong credit history and consistent revenue.
description: Flexible financing option that provides access to funds as needed, similar to a credit card.

name: Equipment Financing
eligibility: Businesses purchasing machinery, vehicles, or other equipment. Equipment serves as collateral.
description: Financing specifically for purchasing business equipment. Equipment itself serves as collateral.

name: Minority Business Development Agency (MBDA) Grants
eligibility: Minority-owned businesses (African American, Hispanic, Asian American, Native American).
description: Grants and support services to help minority-owned businesses grow and compete in the marketplace.

name: Rural Business Development Grant (RBDG)
eligibility: Businesses located in rural areas. Supports training, technical assistance, and business planning.
description: Grants to support business development in rural communities through training and technical assistance.
